comments.body: Does just typing `make` do both targets?  Or does the user have to know which targets to make?  If the latter, then the makefile seems like a worse experience for the user.

Typing make will just do "build" and I have deliberately made it so rather than adding a "all: build pus" rule because I think it is safer and more flexible to decouple the process of building from pushing. For example, to help me locally debug and test an image I want to build it, test it out, and when I am happy with it then I will push it. I don't expect anyone other than me is going to run this Makefile which is mainly designed to mitigate the joint effects of RSI and erratic typing on my part.
